subject: Re: [junit] Constructor that contains static method
msgSnippet: ... The null pointer is in Utils.getMyAdminGroup() and not in your constructor. Look closely at the stack trace. This is not necessarily of JUnit issue.
messageBody:
>So said bronz100 on 2003-06-30 --------------------
>Hi
>I have a Constructor that sets up a global variable using a static
>method. When trying to test this constructor I get a
>NullPointerException pointing to the static method in the constructor.
>Example of my code is below:
>
>public Tax()throws DataSetException, SQLException{
> this.countryId = getCountryId(Utils.getMyAdminGroup());
>}

The null pointer is in Utils.getMyAdminGroup() and not in your constructor. Look closely at the stack trace. This is not necessarily of JUnit issue. Something in your system is accidentally initializing Utils. That's a Bad Thing.

You could patch it with a static initializer, but you should really understand how Utils is being initialized and factor that out of global data. Global Data and Unit Testing don't mix.

Take care.
